programme.title: Boiling Point
programme.desc: A Treasury agent (Wesley Snipes) and a mobster (Dennis Hopper) hunt each other according to their separate-but-equal deadlines for success.

programme.title: Bullet to the Head
programme.desc: After his partner is killed, a veteran hit man (Sylvester Stallone) joins forces with a New Orleans detective (Sung Kang) against a ruthless real-estate developer (Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje).

programme.title: Surviving the Game
programme.desc: Chosen to lead hunters (Rutger Hauer, Charles S. Dutton) on an expedition, a homeless man (Ice-T) discovers he is to be their prey.

programme.title: Women in Cages
programme.desc: A sadistic prison matron (Pam Grier) victimizes an innocent woman (Jennifer Gan), who is serving time for her lover's drug dealings.

programme.title: The Big Doll House
programme.desc: Women (Judy Brown, Pam Grier, Roberta Collins) in pastel dresses plot an escape from a tropical island prison run by perverts.

programme.title: The Big Bird Cage
programme.desc: Women rebel against slave labor in a filthy jungle prison where they feed sugar cane to a mechanical maw.

programme.title: The Big Bust Out
programme.desc: A sea captain and a nun help seven beautiful prison escapees evade police officers and white slavers.

programme.title: Black Brigade
programme.desc: A group of soldiers with no combat experience hold a World War II dam for their bigoted captain (Stephen Boyd).

programme.title: Black Spring Break
programme.desc: Two sports agents follow a football star and his friend on spring break in hopes that he will sign with them.

programme.title: Malibooty
programme.desc: Three buddies (Brian Hooks, Sticky Fingaz, J.T. Jackson) leave their Arizona town and head to California for a wild beach party.

programme.title: Q: The Movie
programme.desc: With his parents away, a young man (Brian Hooks) throws a barbecue that soon turns into an uncontrollable party.

programme.title: The Luau
programme.desc: A man who owes a large sum of cash throws a party that soon spirals out of control just to raise some money.

programme.title: Burglar
programme.desc: A San Francisco cat burglar (Whoopi Goldberg) is blamed for a murder she sees during a jewel heist she must make.

programme.title: Under the Cherry Moon
programme.desc: News of a trust-fund beauty (Kristin Scott Thomas) inspires the pianist (Prince) at a hotel in Nice on the Riviera.

programme.title: Graffiti Bridge
programme.desc: The Kid (Prince) and his rock-club rival (Morris Day) disagree about music in a sequel to the 1984 film "Purple Rain."
